intro: Cassipourea annobonensis, commonly known as the Annobon Island cassipourea, is a shrub native to the island of Annobon in the Gulf of Guinea. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and produces small, white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
